channel.title: Host to Guest clipboard sharing for non-GUI, CLI-only, non-grapical, command line only
channel.description:
From here: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/VirtualBox_Guest_Additions > For Whonix-Gateway, one directional clipboard sharing from host to Whonix-Gateway is enabled and secure.
Clipboard sharing in GUI Gateway works. But how can I paste from Host to Guest in non-GUI Gateway? What I usually do is turning on GUI in Gateway and edit (pasting) in Tor config file. If clipboard sharing works in commandline environment that would be more convenient to work with.

item.title: Host to Guest clipboard sharing for non-GUI, CLI-only, non-grapical, command line only
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
This is a missing feature in VirtualBox. Nothing the Whonix team can do
about this anytime soon.

As per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Support#Free_Support_Principle please
check if there is an existing feature request against VirtualBox and
create one if applicable. Please sahre the resulting link here.

Read full topic
item.source: Host to Guest clipboard sharing for non-GUI, CLI-only, non-grapical, command line only

item.title: Host to Guest clipboard sharing for non-GUI, CLI-only, non-grapical, command line only
item.dc:creator: Areij
item.description:
From here: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/VirtualBox_Guest_Additions

For Whonix-Gateway, one directional clipboard sharing from host to Whonix-Gateway is enabled and secure.

Clipboard sharing in GUI Gateway works. But how can I paste from Host to Guest in non-GUI Gateway?
What I usually do is turning on GUI in Gateway and edit (pasting) in Tor config file. If clipboard sharing works in commandline environment that would be more convenient to work with.

Read full topic
item.source: Host to Guest clipboard sharing for non-GUI, CLI-only, non-grapical, command line only
